image.altText: Deb knelt next to a stone headstone.

props.synopsis: Months after New South Wales became the first state to reform the "outdated" law banning people from being laid to rest with their pets, advocates are urging the Victorian government to catch up.

title.children: Calls to change 'outdated' laws to permit owners to be buried with their pets

image.altText: Evelyn Araluen sits in a white chair, leaning slightly forward, with her hair tucked behind her ears, looking into the camera

props.synopsis: Writers scheduled to appear at the event in central Victoria this weekend are refusing to turn up because of a code of conduct they believe limits freedom of speech.

title.children: Dozens of writers quit Bendigo festival over Gaza censorship concerns

image.altText: Formula and Baby Bottles. Infant milk formula on kitchen background

props.synopsis: Police allege people on student and temporary visas have been stealing baby formula, medicines and vitamins from supermarkets in Melbourne, and then passing them to others who then on-sell the items for profit.

title.children: $10 million theft of baby formula and other items from Melbourne supermarkets

image.altText: A black and white image of a man sitting indoors smiling in a black puffer jacket.

props.synopsis: The former boss of Genius Childcare, which owes creditors millions of dollars, has pleaded guilty to dealing with proceeds of crime.

title.children: Former childcare boss pleads guilty to dealing with suspected proceeds of crime

image.altText: A smiling woman wearing glasses and short hair.

props.synopsis: It is believed Annette Brennan's body was put into a wheelie bin that was collected from a home in Coolaroo in 2024.

title.children: Manslaughter plea over death of woman whose body was found at Melbourne tip

image.altText: mine operations and lots of equipment

props.synopsis: A Victorian court hears noise from the state's biggest gold mine has made a couple's Axedale home a "living hell".

title.children: Home turned into 'place of torture' by gold mine, court hears

image.altText: A black and white photos of a young woman with brown hair, close up on her face.

props.synopsis: Police arrest and charge a 67-year-old man over the 1994 murder of 24-year-old Castlemaine woman Samantha Mizzi.

title.children: Police charge 67yo with murder in 1994 Melbourne cold case

image.altText: A man in a burnt out forest.

props.synopsis: A Victorian Department of Energy, Environment and Climate Action restructure is expected to affect 350 jobs in agriculture, solar, bushfire and forest services.

title.children: Victorian government cuts 350 jobs in environment department restructure

image.altText: A generic photo of a children's toy truck laying sideways, with a colourful abacus in the background.

props.synopsis: Children's commissioner Anne Hollonds says regulations are far too weak in a sector supposed to care for Australia's youngest and most vulnerable citizens.

title.children: Government scrambles to revoke check after latest childcare allegations surface

image.altText: Tup is wearing a brown cowboy styled hat and stands next to a chestnut coloured horse

props.synopsis: A 28-year-old from regional Victoria becomes bronc riding world champion, just 18 months after starting in the sport.

title.children: Bronc riding champion wants more women to take up daring sport

image.altText: An artist's render of a development at Melbourne's Queen Vic Markets

props.synopsis: Federal approval has been granted for a major new housing development near the Queen Victoria Market likely to unlock thousands of homes.

title.children: Low-cost housing, student accommodation to be built near Queen Vic Market

image.altText: A large orange sign positioned against a gravel road and bushland.

props.synopsis: A regional Victorian council decision to cease maintenance on a network of alpine roads has sparked fury in the community, with locals fearing a hit to tourism.

title.children: Outdoor enthusiasts and locals decry plan to abandon remote tourist roads

image.altText: Two Basenji dogs sitting down. One dog has black and white fur, the other has light brown and white fur.

props.synopsis: In the Strathbogie ranges in north-east Victoria, basenji dogs Audrey and Winnie are busy sniffing the ground in search of truffles, as demand for the luxury item grows.

title.children: WATCH: Truffle dogs get to work as demand for crop grows

image.altText: GettyImages-633654696

props.synopsis: Through selection, the "Darcy Vescio Show" and the after party till 5am — this is the inside story of the first AFLW game.

title.children: Making history and partying to sunrise: The story of the first AFLW game

image.altText: Archie Wilson crying during a press conference for University of Nebraska.

props.synopsis: Australian teenager Archie Wilson, who is chasing a dream of being a punter in American football, has broken down while discussing living away from his family.

title.children: Homesickness takes toll on Australian chasing American football dream

image.altText: An adults holds a baby's feet in the palm of their hands.

props.synopsis: Mapping the vast number of environmental and lifestyle factors that influence our health is an enormous task — but one researchers say could hold the key to better understanding disease development.

title.children: Two decades after mapping the human genome, scientists look to the 'exposome'

image.altText: A children's toy bear laying sideways on a floor.

props.synopsis: A string of regulatory failings saw a Victorian childcare worker retain a legal clearance to work with children — despite being blacklisted from the industry after an investigation found he was grooming toddlers.

title.children: Childcare worker who 'groomed toddlers' to lose Working with Children Check

image.altText: A sketch of a man with dark hair and a dark beard in a dark t-shirt.

props.synopsis: The man accused of murdering Athena Georgopoulos and her partner Andrew Gunn at a unit in Mount Waverley on Monday night faces court for the first time.

title.children: Man accused of murdering pregnant woman and partner faces Melbourne court

image.altText: An irrigation channel flows away from camera into the distance.

props.synopsis: The Murray-Darling Basin Authority argues it acted conservatively to manage the risks of water shortfalls, including the use of over-bank flows, in its defence against a class action brought by 28,000 irrigators.

title.children: MDBA defends deliberate forest flooding in billion-dollar class action

image.altText: A man stands in front of a TV screen projecting a deepfake version of himself at a desk.

props.synopsis: The AI revolution is well underway in Australia's schools but what does that mean for the way students learn and think?

title.children: This school principal turned himself into a deepfake AI. What's next?

image.altText: Western United player Riku Danzaki controls the ball while a teammate looks on.

props.synopsis: Former A-League player Riku Danzaki will avoid jail after pleading guilty to deliberately receiving yellow cards in an illegal betting scheme.

title.children: Former A-League player avoids jail after admitting role in betting scheme

image.altText: Maroubra Housing

props.synopsis: Australia is now a "home owner's welfare state", leading economists argue, and if the tax treatment of housing were reformed, the nation as a whole would benefit.

title.children: Australia is a 'home owners' welfare state'. Taxing the family home may be the answer

image.altText: Erin Patterson looks at the camera as she sits in the back of a prison van

props.synopsis: A Victorian judge says prosecutors were seeking to use "dubious" arguments to convict Erin Patterson of poisoning her husband before the Crown abandoned its case.

title.children: Dropped Erin Patterson poisoning charges were 'dubious', judge says

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: A man has been killed after his motorcycle collided with a car in Moe, in Victoria's Latrobe Valley.

title.children: Motorcyclist dies after colliding with car in Victoria's east

image.altText: An illustration of two small whales, one with its mouth open showing sharp teeth, about to eat fish.

props.synopsis: A 25-million-year-old skull has led researchers to discover a new species of tiny whale, filling an evolutionary gap for humpback and blue whales.

title.children: Big-eyed ancient whale with razor-sharp teeth discovered via fossil

image.altText: man in black top standing in front of brick wall behind bar

props.synopsis: A business owner who spent $40,000 connecting to natural gas last year now faces a $20,000 bill to convert to electric, before Solstice Energy shuts the gas network in his town.

title.children: Residents hit with 'poorly planned' gas shutdown ask for compensation

image.altText: GettyImages-97340442

props.synopsis: It was a season that would go down in history as one of the great AFL performances. Now, the five men who played for the Blues for the first time in 1995 tell their stories of that incredible year.

title.children: How five debuts help tell the story of Carlton's remarkable 1995 season

image.altText: An aerial shot of a large multi-storey hospital with a glass and concrete split level facade.

props.synopsis: Freedom of Information documents obtained by the ABC reveal staff raised concerns that no move date had been given for the new Footscray Hospital opening months before the state government announced delays.

title.children: Staff had concerns about Footscray Hospital opening before delays announced

image.altText: MDMA tablet

props.synopsis: More Victorians died of drug overdoses in 2024 compared to any other year in the past decade, a new Coroners Court of Victoria report shows, with a 16 per cent increase in deaths since 2015.

title.children: Victoria records highest number of fatal overdoses in a decade

image.altText: An illustration of a young boy staring at a computer. He is surrounded by text bubbles.

props.synopsis: An investigation by triple j hack uncovers allegations of young people in Australia being sexually harassed and even encouraged to take their own life by AI chatbots.

title.children: AI chatbots accused of encouraging teen suicide as experts sound alarm

image.altText: A palm tree growing dates in a dry orchard

props.synopsis: Dates are a niche industry in Australia, but the growers' association hopes the promise of a lucrative export market and a unique geographical position could make it an appealing one.

title.children: Date industry looking for growers keen to capture 'sellers' market'

image.altText: Luamon Lual on the ground as umpire, Essendon teammate Dylan Shiel, and trainers stand nearby during an AFL game against Geelong

props.synopsis: Dylan Shiel will miss Essendon's AFL clash with St Kilda after copping a ban for pushing a Geelong player into a contest that sent fellow Bomber Luamon Lual spectacularly sprawling to the turf.

title.children: Essendon star banned for a game over incident that hurt his own teammate

image.altText: East Perth and South Fremantle WAFL players in the mud at Leederville Oval.

props.synopsis: The West Coast Eagles' AFLW season opener cannot be played at the recently upgraded Leederville Oval due to an unsafe playing surface.

title.children: Eagles' AFLW opener moved from upgraded stadium due to quagmire

image.altText: A view from the stands at Manuka Oval during an AFL game

props.synopsis: The race for the location of the AFL’s 20th team is heating up. As powerbrokers across the nation are starting to stake their claims, Sean Lawson and Cody Atkinson look at the options.

title.children: Beyond Tasmania, the race for the AFL's 20th team is heating up

image.altText: A man with short dark hair wearing black sunglasses and a black top holds a red AFL football on a film set.

props.synopsis: The international hip-hop artist has been announced as the pre-game entertainment for the 2025 AFL grand final.

title.children: Snoop Dogg to entertain MCG crowd at the AFL grand final
